Labels should bear at least the following information: � the designated name of the product and the internal code reference where applicable; � a batch number given at receipt; � where appropriate, the status of the contents (e.g. in quarantine, on test, released, rejected); � where appropriate, an expiry date or a date beyond which retesting is necessaryWhen fully computerised storage systems are used, all the above information need not necessarily be in a legible form on the labelStarting materials in the storage area should be appropriately labelled (see Chapter 5, item 13)

Products in which contamination is likely to be most significant are those administered by injection, those given in large doses and/or over a long timeThis risk of accidental cross-contamination arises from the uncontrolled release of dust, gases, vapours, sprays or organisms from materials and products in process, from residues on equipment, and from operators clothingContamination of a starting material or of a product by another material or product must be avoided

regulation.reg_text: Samples taken away from the packaging line should not be returned

Samples taken away from the packaging line should not be returnedOn-line control of the product during packaging should include at least checking the following: a) general appearance of the packages; b) whether the packages are complete; c) whether the correct products and packaging materials are used; d) whether any over-printing is correct; e) correct functioning of line monitors
